Title: Senior Java Developer
Blurb:

To realize our potential, we need highly intelligent, collaborative people who are committed to solving challenging problems in a dynamic environment. Do you love exciting opportunities where you can make a big difference? One Network offers you the chance to fuel our rapid growth and make a true impact, while working with the latest advancements in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Supply Chain Planning technologies.

Job Title:

Senior Software Developer

Reports to:

Development Manager

Department:

Engineering

Job Summary:

Work with a small team of highly skilled, high intellect people to design and develop internet based supply chain execution applications using iterative development methodology in startup environment.

Essential Functions:

Work with product management and customers to understand marketing and customer requirementsSelect appropriate software technologies to accomplish product objectivesDesign applications to address marketing and customer driven requirementsDocument designs and host design reviewsImplement and unit test softwareWork with technical writer to ensure requirements and designs are properly reflected in users manualsWork with test team to ensure thorough understanding and test cases provide coverage of featuresPerform code reviews with peersAddress issues and bugs as they arise out of testing an production

Other Duties and Responsibilities:

As determined by manager.

Qualifications

Good working knowledge of Java, J2EE & J2EE application servers, Struts, JDBC, SQL, Oracle database, business object modeling, & OO design.

Experience developing high performance, highly scalable OLTP systems.

XML/XSD, JAXB, SOAP & other B2B protocols a plus.

Education:

BS Degree.

MS Degree a plus

Experience:

6+ years experience developing java based applications

Special Skills:

Understanding of supply chain applications a plus

Mental/Physical Qualifications:

Ability to make good judgment decisions, Self-Motivated, Self-Confident, desire to learnCompany DescriptionOne Network, the pioneer in multi-party supply chain network technology, is changing the way the worlds most respected companies make business decisions. To realize our potential, we need highly intelligent, collaborative people who are committed to solving challenging problems in a dynamic environment. Do you love exciting opportunities where you can make a big difference? One Network offers you the chance to fuel our rapid growth and make a true impact, while working with the latest advancements in AI, Machine Learning, and Supply Chain Planning and Execution technologies.

Title: Web Designer/Developer Intern
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}A new E-Commerce jewelry company based in Forest Hills NY, is looking to hire a highly dynamic and results-oriented Web Designer/Developer Intern to operate and drive traffic to our online business.

Job responsibilities of the Web Designer/Developer Intern include buy not limited to:

 Implement and maintain the online business through Shopify & oversee the marketplace operations.

 Develop site merchandising strategies to achieve sales and profit margin goals.

 Identify new business opportunities to increase the online assortment and improve online inventory availability by sourcing, onboarding, and managing new client relationships.

 Execute merchandising strategies online across category, subcategory, and other site content across the platforms to contribute to overall business goals.

 Product selections and update new products to e-commerce platforms.

 Pack and ship products.

 Organize and track daily products number and variety through inventory management and quality control.

 Update social media daily through marketing campaigns, advertising etc

 Writing articles, newsletters and blogging.

 Contact clients to coordinate with their demands of time, products and shipping details.

 Drive traffic and direct customers certain new products or promotional products through Keywords and SEO.

 Positioning and market the products and the potential customers of target groups.

 A creative thinker with excellent interpersonal, communication, analytic and problem solving skills.

Web Designer/Developer Intern candidates must possess the following qualifications:

 1+ years experience in eCommerce supported by a proven record of success.

 Self-motivated, Self-starter but remains a team player.

 Knowledge of Photoshop.

 Strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills required. A born communicator with inherent salesmanship qualities.

 Superior organizational and time management skills.

 Wants more for themselves than just a weekly salary.

 Enthusiastic with excellent people skills.

 Web Design - Online store - eCommerce Specialist.

 Search Engine optimization - Search Engine marketing.

 Social Media management - Social media marketing - Social media stores.

 Marketplace Ebay/Amazon - Amazon SEO - Amazon Rank.

 Google / Bing / Yahoo ( Business - Webmaster - Analytics )

Web Designer/Developer Intern hours:

 Mon-Thurs 10:00 am - 4:00 pm

Web Designer/Developer Intern Benefits:

 Compensation: (Based on Experience) $150 Weekly Base Pay PLUS Monthly Bonuses.

WEEKLY BASE + MONTHLY BONUSES = ANNUALLY $15K - $25K

Please include samples of your work and email your resume to be considered.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $15,000.00 to $25,000.00 /year

Experience:

SEO: 1 year (Preferred)Digital Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)

Application Question:

We will be conducting onsite interviews from 9:00 am - 3:00 pm, which 2 time slots that you are available?

Additional Compensation:

CommissionBonusesOther forms

Work Location:

One location

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityHigh stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment

This Company Describes Its Culture as:

Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesPeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

Role: React.js Developer

Location: Leeds


Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is here in Leeds whats stopping you?



Join Accenture in Leeds and help transform leading organisations, communities and digital products that have local, national and international impact. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and innovate provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.


This is what we do

Though we offer a wide range of services to the market, a core part of what we do is build exciting, modern, digital products for our clients. We work across the UK and the globe with an exciting array of clients across all industries helping them power some of the worlds best-known digital products and services. We have partnered successfully with Channel 4 over the past two years to build their All 4 product and are excited to be helping them with their growth in Leeds. They join an ever-growing list of high-profile clients that we work within the City and wider region.

We are evangelists of agile engineering and the media & entertainment industry. Despite being a large global brand with over 482,000 employees, we strive to cultivate thriving local environments and ensure we focus on the individual. Were excited about bringing this to Leeds.


This is what were looking for

Candidates passionate about building and running consumer-facing digital products to join our engineering team in Leeds
Born collaborators, who thrive when working in a dynamic agile engineering environment
A keen eye for production performance, operability and maintainability and security

Key skills and responsibilities

Strong JavaScript skills with wide-ranging interest in different frameworks and implementations, including significant experience working with React/Redux and Node
A keen eye for production performance, operability and maintainability and security
Experience building cloud-native Digital products and an awareness of the infrastructure concepts and challenges that power those JavaScript applications
Experience in using automated testing platforms, unit tests, UI testing frameworks and REST APIs

Your Mission
As a Salesforce Developer at Accenture, here is a flavour of what you might experience:Working with Accenture Cloud First to offer transformational and differentiated cloud services to our clients across leading and emerging application platforms in particular Salesforce, Workday, Google, and PegaExperience with Tquila, the leading Salesforce boutique consulting company in the UK, and Cloud Sherpas, a global leader in cloud advisory and technology services specializing in Salesforce, Google for Work and ServiceNow, which are being integrated into the Cloud First Application Team in the UK after being acquired by Accenture in 2015Working with clients to capture business requirements, design to be processes, configure, customise and test software as a service solutions, design and implement integration to existing systems and manage business adoption and deployment activitiesUsing your functional or technical expertise to form part of delivery team, designing and implementing software-as-a-service solutions.A central role in the delivery team throughout the entire lifecycle, using both agile and waterfall delivery and experience in getting the best from the platform



Wed like to work with you if

You have, or are working towards, a certification in Salesforce platform.

You have experience of Apex and Visualforce. 

You're comfortable working with both waterfall and agile methodologies and have exposure across the full delivery lifecycle

Role: Salesforce Technical Consultant / Developer

Package: 35,000 80,000 pa + Benefits (Based on experience and level)

Location: London

Travel: up to 100% flexibility

Closing date: 31st August 2020



ARE YOU READY to step up to the New and take your technology expertise to the next level?

Role Overview 

The Technical Consultant / Developer in salesforce.com is a key member of our Salesforce capability. Depending on Career Level, contribution from the Technical Consultant / Developer varies from development of code, to requirements analysis, to technical solution design, to solution estimating and planning, as well as mentoring and leading technical teams. The role is client facing and travel will be essential, both domestically abroad (predominantly Europe).

We are recruiting for this role across all career levels: Senior Analyst, Specialist, Associate Manager, Manager, Senior Manager


Role: Salesforce Technical Consultant / Developer

Package: 35,000 80,000 pa + Benefits (Based on experience and level)

Location: London

Travel: up to 100% flexibility

Closing date: 31st August 2020



ARE YOU READY to step up to the New and take your technology expertise to the next level?

Role Overview 

The Technical Consultant / Developer in salesforce.com is a key member of our Salesforce capability. Depending on Career Level, contribution from the Technical Consultant / Developer varies from development of code, to requirements analysis, to technical solution design, to solution estimating and planning, as well as mentoring and leading technical teams. The role is client facing and travel will be essential, both domestically abroad (predominantly Europe).

We are recruiting for this role across all career levels: Senior Analyst, Specialist, Associate Manager, Manager, Senior Manager

Role Responsibilities:




The range of responsibilities is broad and will depend on your Career Level, but is likely to include:

Formulation and authoring of code (APEX) to satisfy solution designs, using secure, best-practice methods and approaches. APEX is Salesforces proprietary programming language for building applications on the Salesforce platform.
Formulation, authoring and execution of tests associated with engineering software.
Adoption, operation and execution of build and test automation practices in developer operations, essential for working at the scale at which we operate in our clients.
Formulation of technical designs to satisfy business requirements and solve complex technical and business challenges, including authoring of technical and non-technical documentation as required
Participation in and with teams including colleagues (who may be globally distributed) and customers and their third-party agents, to agree requirements, plans and outcomes in order to achieve business objectives.
Estimation and resource planning associated with solution delivery, defining standards, solutions and schedules that can be delivered (applicable if you are career level Technical Lead or above, working with Accenture Solution Architecture and Leadership teams).
Serve as trusted advisor to client stakeholders across business and architecture / technical functions.
Manage, mentor and lead Accenture Technical Teams (applicable if you are career level Technical Lead or above).

Role Requirements:





 Basic Qualifications:


A minimum of 1 year experience with programming Languages APEX and VisualForce.
A minimum of 6 months exposure to Salesforce.com APEX data loader.

 Preferred:


Ability to adapt to a dynamic work environment and be creative within a team.
Ability to solve problems
Knowledge of Cloud Computing (SaaS, PaaS) and Salesforce.com, either through work at industry participants or consulting to the industry.
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent

The extent and nature of your experience and your proficiency in the skills you have developed to date will determine your career level.

You will receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You'll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialisation. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.

If this sounds like the ideal role, career and company for you, click below to apply.

Location: London, Manchester

Career Levels Available: Senior Analyst, Consultant, Associate Manager, Manager, Senior Manager

Travel: up to 100% (variable)

Salary: 35,000pa - 90,000pa + Benefits (Based on experience and level)

Closing date: 31st December 2019

Accenture believes Every Business is a Digital Business and in so doing we support our clients to align and integrate their technology.

Working across multiple industries our Advanced Technology Architecture (ATA) teams combine deep technology, business and industry expertise to design and deliver some of the largest, most challenging and highest profile technology solutions in the world. Accenture supports and fosters inclusion and diversity in the workplace and we strongly encourage women and men with a passion for and experience in Technology to join our business. Emma McGuigan a Global Technology MD who leads the UK Technology practice and is recognised as #12 on the list of Computer Weeklys 50 most influential women in UK IT 2015 states We have to work to not only create ambition for young women but really open doors for the breadth of opportunities available to them. Diverse teams are the way forward.

Accenture are recognised for their inclusive working environment through the following awards:

 Sunday Times Top 25 Best Big Companies to work for

 A Top employer within The Times Top 50 Employers for Women

 Excellent Maternity package / Shared parental leave

 Flexible working hours

Description

Working in Advanced Technology Architecture you will help to define and deliver solutions for clients, integrating both custom and packaged technologies. This will involve working with clients and other Accenture solution teams to cover the complete life cycle of systems delivery from the initial agreement solutions functional and technical requirements through to delivery and operation.

Your experience should cover a mixture of technology, process and business change, using technology to fundamentally transform the way businesses operate.

Key Responsibilities:

Successful candidates will be able to demonstrate not only an understanding of the different aspects of data architecture, but also creation of business cases for development of data architecture and lifecycle strategies, engineering solutions, implementation plans and estimates; an understanding of the pros and cons of different approaches; and an ability to work independently throughout the full data management lifecycle.

 Requirements gathering, project planning and management, solution design, configuration and customization of data products.

 Technical analysis and documentation of integrated systems

 Provide expert advice on data products, change management and other advisory services

 Suggest solutions to customer based on best practice

 Provide guidance on test plans and end-user documentation

Successful candidates will be able to demonstrate not only an understanding of the different aspects of data architecture, but also creation of business cases for development of data architecture and lifecycle strategies, engineering solutions, implementation plans and estimates; an understanding of the pros and cons of different approaches; and an ability to work independently throughout the full data management lifecycle.

 Requirements gathering, project planning and management, solution design, configuration and customization of data products.

 Technical analysis and documentation of integrated systems

 Provide expert advice on data products, change management and other advisory services

 Suggest solutions to customer based on best practice

You will need:

 A passion for Data Architecture

 The confidence and poise to become the trusted advisor of board level client executives

 Leadership abilities - transfer vision into results

 A collaborative and team-building attitude

 To be fully mobile, often working on-site with our clients

 Strong communication skills (speaking, writing, listening)

Technology

Candidates should demonstrate a detailed understanding, plus an ability to communicate to our clients, the principles of data architecture and engineering across multiple domains. Experience should include a mix of in-depth and broader areas from:

 Architecture and implementation using:

o One or more data modeling techniques and tools across all phases of the lifecycle

o Physical design and architecture of the databases/datastore

o Expertise in architecture, behavior and use cases of different data platforms (e.g. RDBMS, NoSQL, Graph, Blockchain)

o Expertise in extracting content from data analytical, statistical and logic skills

o Data Lifecycle management including data retention, archive and purge planning

o Data Security including protecting from theft, inappropriate use, conformance with regulatory requirements

o Hands on experience of one or more key technology areas (e.g. Oracle, Hadoop stack, MSSQL, Informatica, Ab Initio, Tibco, Spark, Kafka)

o Point skills in data management languages such as SQL; database management, administration & tuning; commonly used tools e.g. QlikView, SQL Developer

o Understanding of key infrastructure elements

o Understanding of key performance and tuning areas

o Understanding of data management within the E2E architecture

o Cloud based data stores

o Key industry software solutions (EBS, SAP, SalesForce etc.)

Qualifications:

Bachelors Degree (or equivalent)

Location: Newcastle



Travel: up to 100% flexibility


Career Levels: We have roles available across a range of Accenture career levels including Analyst, Senior Analyst, Specialist & Associate Manager level.



Salary: 25,000 to 67,760k+ (depending on skills and experience)

 

Join Accenture and help transform leading organisations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.

Accenture Technology powers our clients to achieve high performance with best in class established and emerging technologies. We are able to extend our technology and business capabilities by working closely with market leaders and innovators to provide our clients with the best specialised skills and tailored solutions.

Skills and Experienced Required;

Experience working within a Technical Architecture or lead Developer role
Experience directing and assisting junior technical and non-technical resources
Experience working in client-facing environments helping bridge business and technical
Experience in designing and delivering complex solutions across a range of problem spaces
Experience of working on projects using UK Government GDS methodologies/principles
Specific experience of working on multi-channel websites and associated technologies
An understanding of key architectural design patterns such as microservices and event-driven architecture
An understanding of key enterprise and system level Security and Data Protection approaches
A passion for learning new technologies with a no fear approach (i.e. installing and trying) and preferably some experience of one large-scale Cloud provider e.g. AWS
A natural problem solver who relishes a challenge
A degree in a relevant subject
If youve answered yes to most of the above questions and would like to work with a talented team of people, then wed love to talk to you. We recognise the pivotal role that our architects play in successful project delivery and therefore make a significant continual investment in training to keep the group up-to-date with the latest technologies.

 Complying with and helping to enforce design and coding standards, policies and procedures.

 Ensuring quality of coded components by performing thorough testing.

 Ensuring documentation is well maintained where required.

 Reporting status, issues and risks to management on a regular basis.

Wed like to work with you if

 You have experience in RPA Development and can demonstrate this.

 You have commercial IT experience with a strong understanding of programming concepts (preferably from a programming background with experience of at least one coding language).

 You have hands on experience of at least one industry standard RPA tool (UiPath/Blue Prism/Automation Anywhere etc.).

 You understand the software development lifecycle and methodologies (preferably experience of Agile).

 You are self-motivated, team players who are action and results oriented.

 You are well organised with strong communication and reporting skills.

Not required, but it would be awesome if...

 You hold industry relevant RPA certifications.

 You are experienced in mentoring and coaching Junior Developers and performing code reviews for quality control.

Youll want to work with us if

You want to help transform leading organisations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.

You want comprehensive, continuous training for your specialist area, as well as for professional skills development

We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialised skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with others. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.

You want some phenomenal benefits

We have an extensive benefits package which includes 25 days vacation per year, gym subsidies, discounts across major brands, private medical insurance and 3 extra days leave per year for charitable work of your choice!

You want to be part of a 'Truly Human' environment

Accenture provides an extensive network of over 1,300 trained mental health allies and prioritises mental health at the top of our UKI Inclusion & Diversity Agenda. We are committed to raising awareness and educating Accenture people about our LGBT community while supporting our LGBT employees worldwide. Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

Any offer of employment is subject to satisfactory BPSS clearance

Closing Date for Applications 31/05/2020. Accenture reserves the right to close the role prior to this date should a suitable applicant be found.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}DevOps Engineer (Range of Career Levels available)

Package: 35,000 - 85,000 pa + Benefits (Based on experience and level)

Location: London

Travel: up to 100% flexibility - Client facing role

Closing date: 31st August 2020
We are looking for experienced DevOps Engineers join our vibrant community of DevOps professionals, based out of our London offices on a full-time, permanent basis. Were looking for exceptional individuals to deliver specific solutions for our clients. Working within a high performing delivery team, you will engage directly with our clients to build cutting-edge DevOps Capabilities.
Working as a key member of the team, we are looking for Engineers who are passionate about their work, with innovation and continuous learning at the forefront of their professional development.
Key Technical accountabilities:

Responsible for low level tools and automation design (including cartridges) and delivery.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced Agile delivery environment.
Experience installing and administering multiple industry leading DevOps tools.
Experience administering 1 or more platforms (linux, windows, etc) or large middleware (WebSphere, SAP, etc).
Ability to document as-is process and architectures based on face-to-face interviews.
Experience administering environments and resources on cloud provider (IaaS or PaaS).

Have daily collaboration with one of the IT industrys largest networks of technical DevOps and transformation experts who work to frame and deliver cutting edge solutions for countless varieties of technologies and industries. In doing so, you will help define how DevOps evolves for the world.

Its not all about Technical skills, were also looking for Engineers who possess the below Consulting attributes as well:

Ability to train internal or client teams in technologies (Jenkins, Puppet, Chef, Docker, Monitoring tools etc)
Ability to train internal or client teams in DevOps practices, acting as Scrum Master when required

Key Technical responsibilities may include:


Advising clients on the principles and benefits of Continuous Delivery, DevOps and Agile delivery

Architecting and directing the implementation of all aspects of DevOps and Continuous Delivery solutions for Accenture clients

Helping Accenture clients realise the business benefits of Continuous Delivery, DevOps and Agile delivery

Mentoring and developing junior DevOps professionals

Your Professional Development


Your professional development is important to us. From day one you will be working alongside and in partnership with some of the very best in the business. As part of your career growth, there are several internal and external qualifications that you will have access to, these include:

The AWS Certification Curriculum
The Azure Certification Curriculum
Certified Jenkins Engineer
CNCF Certified Kubernetes Application Developer
Red Hat Certified Specialist in OpenShift Administration
Accentures internal DevOps Academy and DevOps Academy for Executives
The ability to attend and represent Accenture at well-known DevOps conferences including; DevOps Days, Continuous Lifecycle London, Pipeline Conference and DockerCon

Locations: London (must be willing to be based at and travel to client sites throughout the UK)

We are looking for talented FullStack Software Engineers with a passion to positively impact the lives of many through the technology. We are hiring across various Accenture career levels depending on skills and experience.



We Are Makers and Dreamers

Software Engineering is the home of our talented Technology people who are focused on engineering memorable yet differentiated and captivating customer experiences.

We have a seasoned group of cross-industry artisans who provide engineering expertise in the crafts of FullStack, Integration and Java. This includes fluency in Cloud Native, Mobile, AI, Blockchain, Internet of Things, Extended Reality, Frontend, DevOps and Creative Design.

What We Are Looking For
Software Engineering roles adapt to the current business demands and trends and continually evolve. If we were to summarise our current activities:

Architect and implement secure solutions for clients on premise and in the cloud, integrating with existing authentication and security frameworks.

Title: Pega Consultant / Pega Senior Systems Architect
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Role: Pega Consultant / Pega Senior Systems Architect

Location: London, Manchester or Edinburgh

Travel: up to 100%

Salary: 43,000 97,000 + Benefits

Closing Date: 31/12/2020

Introduction

Are you ready to step up and take your technology expertise to the next level?

There is never a typical day at Accenture, but thats why we love it here! This is an extraordinary chance to create a rewarding career at Accenture Technology. Working in a digitally compassionate, innovation-led environment where you can help clients shift to the New using leading-edge technologies on some of the coolest projects you can imagine.

Focus on leading cloud technology-based solutions like Pegasystems, BPM, RPA, Mulesoft, Salesforce and other emerging platforms and technologies to offer comprehensive, industry-focused cloud services that includes strategy, implementation, migration and managed services. Drive broader transformational programs for clients. Thrive in our highly collaborative, digitally driven and innovation-led environment. Nurture your talent for thoughtful and game changing solutions in our inclusive culture that values diversity of ideas, experiences and backgrounds.

We are growing rapidly and is looking to add experienced Pega Consultants to join our team. This role will have day-to-day co-ordination of our application development and architecture teams, onshore and offshore. You'll oversee application development and technical architecture components and drive application developer streams including Pega and integration, technical testing, quality assurance and execution architecture. We'll need you to have a strong understanding of the platform and open source solutions and demonstrated experience in hands-on solution architecture and end-to-end application design. You'll lead development of customized components, so we're looking for candidates who can get their hands dirty and jump in and write code if necessary.

Role: Pega Consultant / Pega Senior Systems Architect

Location: London, Manchester or Edinburgh

Travel: up to 100%

Salary: 43,000 97,000 + Benefits

Closing Date: 31/12/2020

Introduction

Are you ready to step up and take your technology expertise to the next level?

There is never a typical day at Accenture, but thats why we love it here! This is an extraordinary chance to create a rewarding career at Accenture Technology. Working in a digitally compassionate, innovation-led environment where you can help clients shift to the New using leading-edge technologies on some of the coolest projects you can imagine.

Focus on leading cloud technology-based solutions like Pegasystems, BPM, RPA, Mulesoft, Salesforce and other emerging platforms and technologies to offer comprehensive, industry-focused cloud services that includes strategy, implementation, migration and managed services. Drive broader transformational programs for clients. Thrive in our highly collaborative, digitally driven and innovation-led environment. Nurture your talent for thoughtful and game changing solutions in our inclusive culture that values diversity of ideas, experiences and backgrounds.

We are growing rapidly and is looking to add experienced Pega Consultants to join our team. This role will have day-to-day co-ordination of our application development and architecture teams, onshore and offshore. You'll oversee application development and technical architecture components and drive application developer streams including Pega and integration, technical testing, quality assurance and execution architecture. We'll need you to have a strong understanding of the platform and open source solutions and demonstrated experience in hands-on solution architecture and end-to-end application design. You'll lead development of customized components, so we're looking for candidates who can get their hands dirty and jump in and write code if necessary.

Implement

 frameworks, main architecture components and key functionality
Ensure quality

 delivery through proven development methodology and guidance on

 development best-practices Integrate multiple technologies using PegasystemsDrive design, development, testing and deployment of maintainable Pega solutions.

Required Skills:

Certified Pega system architects (CSA) or certified

Pega senior system architects (CSSA) or certified Pega marketing or decisioning

architect5-8 years of experience in design and development

with Pega platform and associated frameworksWork with members of the team to analyse business

requirements, translating those requirements in to customized solutions using

the Pega 7 or Pega 8 platform, Implement Pega solutions that adhere to platform

best practices.Will be responsible for Coding and unit testing

using Pega OOTB features based on the design provided by the Lead System

Architect.Maintain effective team relations and rapport -

delivering timely and relevant information

Nice to have:

Experience in implementing Pega Marketing applications, defining strategies, campaigns,

predictive and adaptive modelsPega Framework exposure on Customer Service,

Marketing etc.Pega DevOpsPega Robotics

Accenture will be

recruiting at the following levels, Senior Analyst, Specialist, Associate Manager,

Manager and Senior Manager.

opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society

Position Summary

This position is responsible for the design, development and implementation of secure software development processes. Consults and advises development teams on secure design, secure development practices and vulnerability management for complex product components. Manages assigned projects independently and will serve as subject matter expert for secure software development associated with specific projects. Will assist Principal, Sr. Principal and Architects to detail secure design and development aspects of products.

Primary Responsibilities

Independently determines and develops approaches to solutions for assigned projects by identifying, resolving and mitigating risk and communicating to stakeholdersProvides technical solutions to detail security aspects of product design and ensures that resulting design specification fits into technical architectural framework. (Coordinates and guides threat model assessments with development teams)Performs analysis to define requirements for modification to existing tools, utilities, system structures, environments and provide technical input into project scope and estimating activitiesRecommends and maintains security design methodologies, processes and standardsProvides security guidance to engineersCoordinates and trains F5 Security Ninjas in Hyderabad, Tel Aviv and WarsawAssist Principal Engineers and Management with project scopeConsistently meet commitmentsAssisting and driving customer solutionsParticipates in hiring and onboarding processConducts presentations internally and externallyResponsible for upholding F5s Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies.Performs other related duties as assigned.The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Passion for securing software productsExtensive experience in using and evangelizing secure development lifecycle best practicesStrong knowledge and extensive experience with relevant platform technologies5+ years programming experience in software languages that support F5 product line (C/C++, Go, Java, JavaScript, PHP)Strong analytic / trouble-shooting skills.Able to collaborate and thrive in a fast-paced high-performance environment.Demonstrated excellence in written and verbal communications.Demonstrated leadership role within project team.Must be a Subject Matter Expert in multiple secure development skill areas.Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material.

Qualifications

Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelors degree; or 6 years and a Masters degree; or equivalent experience.

Position Summary

F5 Networks is hiring a AEM Developer II who can create custom web development. This position will be responsible for taking projects through the entire life cycle. You will tackle problems and resolve complex issues, while working in a distributed environment. A successful team member will be proactive and be collaborative!

Primary Responsibilities

Lead and participate in customer meetings, professionally and expertly

Translate business needs into technical requirements

Provide constructive feedback in code reviews and help others to become better developers

Own the frontend build system and define how frontend tools are to be integrated with platforms such as AEM

Lead the development of scalable single-page applications in AEM

Write well designed, efficient code that works across devices

Build reusable components with HTL (Adobes templating language), CSS and JavaScript

Develop mission-critical authoring and user experiences

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

3-5 years of professional experience with Strong AEM and Java Skills

Built sites using: AEM 6.3 and above

Proficiency with AEM Components, Dialogs, Templates, ClientLibs and Fragments

Understand the tools and frameworks that come with AEM and how they are linked with each other. For example, know what Core WCM Components, ACS Commons, Granite, and Coral UI are, and when to use them

An understanding of design and the ability to fill gaps, for example, if a design doesnt cover all screen sizes or if a design isnt consistent

Experience with the latest frontend tools and technologies, such as SCSS, Webpack, ES6 JavaScript, TypeScript and Storybook.js

Strong communication and problem-solving skills

The ideal candidate has a BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject or has equivalent experience

Ability and ambition to contribute to open source projects and to speak at meetups

Experience with other platforms than AEM, such as Drupal and Magento

Experience with Java and advanced understanding of Apache Maven, a plus

Worked with Agile development, preferably SCRUM

Physical Demands and Work Environment

Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.

Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material.

Duties may require being on call periodically or working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends). Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, approximately 5% of the time spent traveling.

Job may be performed on-site at a customer facility or data center, or in an office environment sitting at a desk or computer table.

The Management, Orchestration, Visualization and Analytics (ManOVA) Application Visibility and Reporting (AVR) team is looking for technically strong Software Engineer. The developer will be responsible for maintain and support the analytics module of a large network security product.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyze, debug and fix customer cases that escalate from support field engineers to the Product Development group

Work in tight connection with customer support personnel

Perform fixes, changes and additions in existing product code

Responsible for upholding F5s Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies

Perform other related duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Ability to analyze logs and catch subtle details that indicate cause and/or refer to common situations

Ability to familiarize with large existing code base

Good communication, presentation skills and ability to work well in a development team and with remote parties

Fast learner

Team player with great interpersonal skills

Experience with Agile methodologies and supporting tools - Advantage

QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum of 3 years of significant software development and engineering experience

Solid hands-on C/C++ programmer  Must

Experience as a user of Linux environments - Must

Experience in debugging C/C++ code with gdb and in analyzing core dump files

Knowledge of TCP/IP networking

Knowledge of SQL and SQL-based databases, preferably MySQL

Knowledge of one or more scripting languages (Perl, Python, ) - Advantage

B.A./B.Sc. in computer science or electrical engineering

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table

Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst III
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

POSITION SUMMARY:

The BI ETL Developer III must possess the technical experience necessary to develop and maintain a Data Warehouse, reporting metadata, and ETL jobs using Informatica and/or Wherescape RED. This role partners with power users, BI front end developers and business analysts to provide data to these individuals in a way that is easy to use in dashboards/reports and analyze. Candidate must have experience designing and delivering BI solutions via ETL tools. This position is regarded as a Subject Matter Expert in the areas of BI, ETL, Data Warehousing, and Data Modeling.

ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB:

This key resource is instrumental in providing data to analysts to support analytical decision making at F5. This role helps to guide and shape the future of BI and Data Warehousing at F5.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

ETL Development (70%)

Proven Business Intelligence experience to include understanding of data warehousing concepts, data marts, OLAP, logical and physical models, and dimensional modeling.Develop ETL code for the Enterprise Data Warehouse using Wherescape RED and Informatica Power Center.Develop and maintain load automation, and data acquisition functions.Responsible for analysis, scope and time estimation of ETL changes required to support complex report and dashboard requirements.Create detailed design documentation, configuration documentation, and unit test plans.Conduct peer, contractor and junior technical consultant code and documentation reviews.Formulate work plans for building to project specifications. Provide for multiple resources coding on same project.Perform configuration, integration and coding per specifications and according to F5 standards. Alter programs to increase efficiency; rewrite to remove errors or adapt to new requirements.Build prototypes for demonstration and illustration purposes for peer groups, Business partners, or senior leaders.Support peers, and stakeholders as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) through troubleshooting, analysis of results, Production Support, and identification of opportunities to solve Business problems through BI.Look for opportunities to improve current processes or find effeciencies by applying industry best practices for BI development.

Production Support (15%)

Troubleshoot load failuresFind root cause of data issuesResolve defects

Data Modeling (15%)

Apply fundamental relational database modeling concepts to all work.Be fluent with the concepts of dimensional modeling for common BI Front End Tools to ensure ease of data extraction, and Front End performance.Partner with peers internal and external to the team to assess and recommend opportunities to derive additional Busines Value out of existing Data Marts.Apply industry best practices around Kimball methodology to build out additional Data Marts while keeping an eye on the end goal of a cohesive, hollistic Data Warehouse. Influence and provide technical recommendations around the DW Roadmap.

Other Responsibilities

Uphold F5s Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies.Perform other related duties as assigned.

Note: The percentages of time noted above are current estimates and may change at any time depending on the business needs of the company.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Strong SQL experienceExperience developing ETL in Informatica Powercenter and/or Wherescape REDExperience developing on Oracle and SQL Server databasesExperience with one or more scripting languages: Python, Perl, BashExperience loading data into databases from databases, file, JSON, and XMLExperience with multiple business data domains (accounting, finance, sales, support, manufacturing, product development)Adept at translating functional requirements into technical solutionsAbility to act as Lead BI Developer on a project, and complete complex developmentAbility to mentor and influence others through exampleDemonstrates excellent analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skillsUnderestands business processes and relationship of systems and applicationsDemonstrates strong time management and organizational skillsAbility to self-motivate, set goals, prioritize and meet deadlinesDemonstrates excellent interpersonal and communication skillsExperience with Azure data platforms and ETL tools is a plus

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or Mathematics or equivalent combination of education and experience required5 to 8 years of industry experience with BI ETL tools  Informatica, Wherescape RED, SSIS5 to 8 years of industry experience in writing and interpreting of SQL queries3 to 5 years of industry experience designing data models and data standardsFluency and real life applications of Kimball data modeling methodologyExperience with Agile or Scrum is desired

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:

List any special environmental conditions, unpleasant conditions and special hazards, as well as any lifting, bending or vision requirements.

Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material.Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends).

Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Job Description

We are seeking a Sr. Software Developer who will help us build SaaS products . You will work with incredible colleagues to contribute to a growing incubation team within F5 Networks. The ideal teammate should be passionate, creative, flexible with a strong work ethic and enjoy solving problems. Our team works remotely and is distributed globally, giving you a chance to interact with colleagues from around the world.

Your Day-to-Day

You will utilize your strong coding skills in Golang

Use your deep experience with TDD for writing both unit and functional tests

You will build quality solutions while keeping focus on high availability, scalability, maintainability, and security while working with a stellar DevOps team.

Be part of a team that will be responsible for the design, development and implementation of products and services running in public clouds.

Focus on orchestration, automation, and monitoring of services in any environment.

You would help with architecture/system design builds & documents focusing on workflows and interfaces as well as building and integrating tools to improve automation, monitoring, and troubleshooting

You would configure and lead a variety of internally developed and third-party applications and services, across multiple environments

We are a group who participates in a 24/7 on-call rotation

You'll help recommend and maintain technical design methodologies, processes, and standards

We help each other thrive by providing technical mentorship to entry level engineers as well as participate in hiring, on boarding, and training process

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Strong OO design and coding skills using multiple stacks, and knowledge of the pros and cons of each

2+ years experience with Golang

8+ years application development experience

Strong data design skills, using both SQL and NoSQL data stores

Experience with CI/CD pipelines such as Jenkins

Experience working with services in a Dockerized environment

Experience with Elasticsearch, Couchbase, Redis, and/or PostgreSQL a plus

Requires 8+ years of related experience with a Bachelors degree; or 6 years and a Masters degree; or a PhD with 3 years experience; or equivalent experience.

F5 Networks is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace

Title: Product Manager - Platforms
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}Product Manager, Freshworks Developer Platform

At Freshworks, we pride ourselves on building powerful, sophisticated software thats fun and easy to use. We believe that customers are the foundation of a successful business and we want to enable every team to deliver moments of wow to them. Founded in October 2010, Freshworks is backed by Accel, Tiger Global Management, CapitalG, and Sequoia Capital India. Freshworks has its HQ in San Bruno, California and global offices in India, UK, Australia, France, and Germany.

About the role :

The Freshworks Marketplace contains over 750 apps that enable our customers to connect their Freshworks product with the other tools that they use. Apps are also used to customise Freshworks products and automate routine tasks. The developer platform team is responsible for building the platform components that developers use to build apps.

As product manager, you will help shape the future of the platform. You will understand customer problems, the competitive landscape, and Freshworks goals and combine this knowledge to develop a compelling vision, strategy, and roadmap. You will work with a cross functional team, and with product managers across Freshworks to build features and drive adoption.

Responsibilities

Develop a compelling vision for the developer platform and articulate it to all stakeholders

Gain a deep understanding of customer and developer problems, identify platform gaps, and generate new ideas

Understand the competitive landscape, and identify opportunities for differentiation

Scope and prioritise activities based on business and customer impact

Identify key performance and non functional metrics and monitor them closely

Qualifications

2+ years of experience as a product manager

A computer science degree or prior experience as a software engineer

Excellent communication skills with a proven ability to quickly absorb technical concepts

Data driven with strong analytical and problem-solving skills

High level of ownership and attention to detail

Title: Developer Evangelist
Blurb:
.css-1noe2rc *{color:#505863;line-height:1.4em;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1{padding-left:0;}.css-1noe2rc .ecgq1xb1 .ecgq1xb0{margin:0 0 8px 0;}.css-1noe2rc ol,.css-1noe2rc ul{padding-left:32px;}.css-1noe2rc li{margin:10px;margin-bottom:5px;margin-left:20px;line-height:1.4em;}.css-58vpdc{margin-bottom:24px;}.css-58vpdc ul{margin:5px 0 10px 20px;}.css-58vpdc ul > br{display:none;}.css-58vpdc ul > li{margin-left:0;}.css-58vpdc li{padding:0;}About Freshworks:-

Freshworks provides innovative customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to acquire, close, and keep their customers for life. Freshworks Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products provide a 360-degree view of the customer, are ready to go, easy to use, and offer a quick return on investment. Own and deliver the Freshworks voice through every piece of content being shipped

Title: Product Consultant
Blurb:
Freshworks Inc. is the parent company behind the suite of products which includes Freshdesk, Freshservice, Freshsales, Freshcaller, Freshteam, Freshchat, and Freshmarketer. The companys suite of products is designed to work tightly together to increase collaboration and help teams better connect and communicate with their customers and co-workers. Founded in October 2010, Freshworks Inc. is backed by Accel, Tiger Global Management, CapitalG, and Sequoia Capital India. Freshworks has its HQ in San Bruno, California, and global offices in India, UK, Australia, and Germany. The company's cloud-based suite of SaaS products is widely used by over 100,000 customers around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba and Cisco.

Overview:

As a Product Consultant - Presales at Freshworks, you will assist the sales/business development team by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You will liaise with Product Management and Marketing to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Freshworks Product Suites. Your job will involve you working closely with cross-functional teams of developers and architects with a variety of both regional and international. The relationship you build with customers are crucial for the overall growth of Freshworks.

We are looking for a Product Consultant - Presales with excellent technical, communication and organizational skills. Any previous experience with customer support, CRM, Mobile applications, ITSM/ITIL Methodologies, and cloud-based infrastructure will be preferred.

As a Product Consultant - Presales you will work hand in hand with the sales team to introduce Freshworks product suite. You will help prospective customers and partners to understand Why Freshworks is important to their business.

Responsibilities

Work with Sales / Business development teams to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections and convert prospects to customers.
Work closely with the product management team to demonstrate and prototype integrations within customer environment.
Prepare and deliver product messaging to highlight Freshworks value proposition through whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstration, proof of concept management and RFP response documents.
Work independently with prospects / customers technical teams on technical scoping. During the process of scoping, you may be involved in complex workflow analysis and in-depth examination of the interaction between Freshworks and customers infrastructure.
Provide technical mentorship and training for new hires and peers.
Implement and support compliance to Freshworks compliance and information security processes.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of experience as a technical sales engineer or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.

Overview

Ideal candidates will engage with our global customer base directly, and decide the future of the product by working closely with our design and engineering teams. You will also collaborate with marketing, sales and support to ensure that word gets out to people and they get to see what you are building.

We want somebody who can identify opportunities everyday, get valuable insights back to the table, and put their foot down so that engineering effort can see light at the end of the tunnel.
3+ yrs experienceExperience in Product Management Role (Preferred)Experience as a platform developer or application engineer in a Product Company is a plus

So, if you think you are up for the excessive fun and the heavy lifting that comes with working at a startup, get in touch with us right away.

Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019 LinkedIn Top 25 Companies to work for in India and a listing on the Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement & IT Service Management. While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $400 million in capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at www.Freshworks.com.

At Freshworks, we are betting on our developer platform to make our SaaS products powerful enough so customers can build lasting solutions to their day- to-day challenges using Freshworks. As Lead for the Platform Marketing function, you will experiment, create and iterate on initiatives that foster the very developer community that will craft applications and integrations on our platform, as well as drive home loud and clear messaging around our platform advantage to our customer base. You will individually own adoption and lead generation metrics and help establish programs to grow our platform marketing muscle around them. You will lead by example and help establish the best practices with this discipline at Freshworks.

Key Responsibilities:
Monitor and assesses the market, including through competitor analysis, in order to realize measures and strategies that the business can adopt to drive platform adoption.
Develop platform positioning and messaging that resonates with customers and establishes our platform strengths in the market
Develop creative marketing collateral inclusive of blogs, infographics, and videos and track and report success based on meaningful metrics.
Actively market platform capabilities and identify and activate new avenues where developers and partners can apply them.
Conceptualize and create enablement content our sales teams can use to win customers in their markets using the platform as a differentiation and a strength
Track and report satisfaction metrics for platform users and engage to identify programs to improve the platform experience.
Evangelize the platform both internally and externally to establish Freshworks alongside its platform abilities.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelors Degree, with an emphasis in technology preferred
At least 3 years of relevant product marketing experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Basic programming abilities to appreciate the platform
Proven experience creating marketing plans encompassing strategy, customer research, competitive analysis, partnerships, messaging and pricing
Appreciation for software technology and related challenges that help translate technical content into marketing material
Organizational talent to plan and execute successful engagement events for partner developers as well as customers
Preferred Qualifications
An MBA with specialization in Marketing
Professional software development or developer relations experience
Curiosity towards technology and trends in computing
Public speaking and writing experience that demonstrate story-telling abilities
A history of thriving on challenges and solving your way out of unique situations

Title: Product Manager - Platforms
Blurb:
Product Manager, Freshworks Developer Platform
At Freshworks, we pride ourselves on building powerful, sophisticated software thats fun and easy to use. We believe that customers are the foundation of a successful business and we want to enable every team to deliver moments of wow to them. Founded in October 2010, Freshworks is backed by Accel, Tiger Global Management, CapitalG, and Sequoia Capital India. Freshworks has its HQ in San Bruno, California and global offices in India, UK, Australia, France, and Germany.
About the role :
The Freshworks Marketplace contains over 750 apps that enable our customers to connect their Freshworks product with the other tools that they use. Apps are also used to customise Freshworks products and automate routine tasks. The developer platform team is responsible for building the platform components that developers use to build apps.
As product manager, you will help shape the future of the platform. You will understand customer problems, the competitive landscape, and Freshworks goals and combine this knowledge to develop a compelling vision, strategy, and roadmap. You will work with a cross functional team, and with product managers across Freshworks to build features and drive adoption.
Responsibilities
Develop a compelling vision for the developer platform and articulate it to all stakeholders
Gain a deep understanding of customer and developer problems, identify platform gaps, and generate new ideas
Understand the competitive landscape, and identify opportunities for differentiation
Scope and prioritise activities based on business and customer impact
Identify key performance and non functional metrics and monitor them closely
Qualifications
2+ years of experience as a product manager
A computer science degree or prior experience as a software engineer
Excellent communication skills with a proven ability to quickly absorb technical concepts
Data driven with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
High level of ownership and attention to detail

Turning UI/UX designs into prototypes, creating awesome interactions from designs, writing reusable content modules and maintainability of the code.

Passionate to create good design and usability
A team player with good communication skills
Knowledge of Ember & Ruby will be a plus
Exposure to Data Structures and Algorithms.

Title: Senior Software Engineer- Security
Blurb:
About Us

Freshworks provides innovative customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to acquire, close, and keep their customers for life. Freshworks Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products provide a 360-degree view of the customer, are ready to go, easy to use, and offer a quick return on investment. Headquartered in San Mateo, USA, Freshworks 2,000+ team members work in offices throughout the world. Freshworks has global offices in India, Singapore, Australia, UK, Netherlands, France, and Germany. The company counts over 220,000 businesses in its customer-for-life community around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba, Sling TV, Sothebys and Cisco.
Freshworks suite of products that transform the way world-class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers, include Freshdesk (Omni-channel customer support), Freshservice (IT Service Desk), Freshsales (Intuitive fully-integrated CRM), Freshmarketer (Marketing Automation Suite), Freshteam (HR Management System for growing teams), Freshchat (Modern messaging software) and Freshcaller (Cloud PBX system).

Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019 LinkedIn Top 25 Companies to Work for in India and a listing on the Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement & IT Service Management. While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $400 million in the capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at www.Freshworks.com.

Purpose of the Role

In todays world, any organization or individual are constantly under the threat of cyber attack and
this is proven through a steady uprise in the security incidents and data breaches year on year.
We at Freshworks are committed to prevent such incidents and provide a secure environment for
our customers to run their business.
Freshworks is looking for a passionate and self-driven application security engineer with the
ability to work independently and collaboratively to enable development teams to build secure
products. You will play a pivotal role in integrating and advancing security by working with
Developers, Product Owners, Program Managers, and Security Engineers. As part of the security
engineering team, you will advocate secure coding, secure design principles, build frameworks to
automate security testing and conduct security assessments to unearth critical vulnerabilities. We
also expect you to deliver training to development and QA teams.

Responsibilities

Threat Modelling:Engage with the development teams to conduct secure design reviews/threat modeling
exercises to enumerates threats and mitigation strategies.Enable the developers with knowledge of threat modeling by conducting focused workshops.
Secure Coding:Prioritize critical defects and ensure these are identified and mitigated during the sprint.Integration and automation of SAST in the DevOps pipeline.Build secure coding principles and propagate across the development community.Be the to-go person for developers in solving critical issues relating to secure product
development.
Security Assessments:Examine the products in detail to discover vulnerabilities and collaborate with the other security
engineers to practically demonstrate the exploitability and risk factors.Be at the forefront of emerging vulnerabilities/threats which could affect Freshworks products
through independent research and study. Engage with the developers in developing
workarounds/mitigation plans and ensure they are implemented per policy.
Training:Build and enhance secure coding/security assessments training contents for developers and
QA team.Deliver training programs at various levels in the organizations.Conduct workshops/security tech-talks to disseminate security knowledge and awareness.
Basic QualificationMaster or Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Science / Engineering, Masters in Computer
Science, Bachelor of Science in Computer Science.5 to 8 years of experience in application security, desirable to have 2 years of software
development experience.Expert-level knowledge in multiple classes of vulnerabilities that includes cross-site scripting,
SQL Injection, CSRF, cryptographic related weakness, and code injection.Good knowledge in programming/scripting languages such as Java, Ruby, and Python.Good knowledge relating to services/technology relating to the cloud.Basic understanding and knowledge in web frameworks and architecture.Ability to communicate and interpret security vulnerabilities to various audiences such as
development and management teams.

Advanced Qualification
Experience with Serverless, Runtime Application Protection Solutions.Experience in integrating and automating security in DevOps through implementing / building
orchestration tools.Strong security development experience in Java / Ruby on Rails.Experience in the implementation of federated authentication/authorization services.
-

Freshworks Inc. is the parent company behind the suite of products which includes Freshdesk, Freshservice, Freshsales, Freshcaller, Freshteam, Freshchat, and Freshmarketer. The companys suite of products is designed to work tightly together to increase collaboration and help teams better connect and communicate with their customers and co-workers. Founded in October 2010, Freshworks Inc. is backed by Accel, Tiger Global Management, CapitalG, and Sequoia Capital India. Freshworks has its HQ in San Bruno, California and global offices in India, UK, Australia, and Germany. The company's cloud-based suite of SaaS products is widely used by over 100,000 customers around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba and Cisco.

Overview

Freshworks is looking to hire a smart product manager who is excited about taking up ideas and bringing them to life. Ideal candidates will engage with our global customer base directly, and decide the future of the product by working closely with our design and engineering teams. You will also collaborate with marketing, sales and support to ensure that word gets out to people and they get to see what you are building.

We want somebody who can identify opportunities everyday, get valuable insights back to the table, and put their foot down so that engineering effort can see light at the end of the tunnel.

- 3+ yrs experience

- Experience in Product Management Role (Preferred)

- Experience as a platform developer or application engineer in a Product Company is a plus

So, if you think you are up for the excessive fun and the heavy lifting that comes with working at a startup, get in touch with us right away.

Seattle Base Salary Range: 112,000 - 142,000 USD per year

UX Developer at Indeed

UX Developers at Indeed serve a critical role in getting designs into production, bridging the design and engineering organizations.

UX Developers work with a cross-functional team to build accessible user interfaces for our products; create fast, scalable, maintainable, and secure systems; define best practices in UI development; and contribute to design ideation and decision making.


The skills of a UX Developer include:

Practical experience with web standards, including JavaScript, CSS, HTML
Knowledge of scripting languages (Python, PHP, )
Knowledge of compiled languages (Java, ...)
Knowledge of ECMAScript features and modern JavaScript frameworks (React, Angular, Ember, )
Knowledge of CSS preprocessor and methodologies
Implementing responsive layouts with adaptive grids, semantic and accessible HTML, unit tests
Understanding the design process in a modern software organization


A deep passion for both code and creativity


Familiarity in Sketch, Photoshop, or similar design tools

This role specifically requires:

2+ years of relevant programming experience
A bachelors degree in Computer Science, Design, or related field, or equivalent industry experience

To really catch our attention, you might offer:

Work experience on a fast-paced, multidisciplinary team
Working with and managing design systems
Experience in visual and/or interaction design

This is a great time to join the Indeed design team. We are growing in size, capabilities, and location and the right individual will find a huge array of opportunities for major impact.
Design at Indeed: https://indeed.design

Title: Front End Software Engineer
Blurb:

We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

We are a rapidly growing and highly capable engineering team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 250 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time. 
The base salary range below represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Long Term Incentive Plan units, an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits. 

Seattle Base Salary Range:Software Engineer I: 112,000 - 142,000 USD per yearSoftware Engineer II: 144,000 - 180,000 USD per yearSenior Software Engineer: 144,000 - 180,000 USD per yearStaff Software Engineer: 178,000 - 225,000 USD per yearPrincipal Software Engineer: 224,000 - 284,000 USD per yearTechnical Fellow: 241,000 - 315,000 USD per year

Were looking for front-end engineers who are eager to be responsible for the user interface of innovative products that see tens of millions of pageviews a day. As a front-end engineer at Indeed, youll bring a wealth of skill and experience in JavaScript and CSS to a full-stack product team, and be ever-vigilant about the performance, accessibility, and sustainability of the solutions youre developing together. You and your team will release new code frequently, and use Indeeds robust a/b testing system to understand and iterate on the changes youre making to help people get jobs.

Indeed is a highly data-driven organization, and that means you wont have to guess at the impact youre having: youll get rapid feedback about how your efforts are speeding up the site, making workflows more efficient, and, ultimately, helping more people get jobs.

As a member of a cross-functional team, youll need to be comfortable making changes outside of the front-end stack typical applications here have a Java or Python back-end but your primary role will be to serve as a source of user interface development expertise on your team. Youll also work with other front-end engineers throughout the organization to solve cross-product concerns, and to help full-stack developers level up their front-end skills.
